docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: President Bush said today that the all-out war on drugs he promised in his Inaugural Address would be mainly an educational effort rather than a law-enforcement crackdown.

headline.main: Bush, Citing Cost, Says Drug War Will Focus Largely on Education

docs.snippet: LEAD: President Bush said today that the all-out war on drugs he promised in his Inaugural Address would be mainly an educational effort rather than a law-enforcement crackdown.

byline.original: By GERALD M. BOYD, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WHITE men receive a greatly disproportionate share of the nation's transplanted kidneys compared with white women and blacks of both sexes, three recent studies have shown.

headline.main: Studies Find Unequal Access to Kidney Transplants

docs.snippet: LEAD: WHITE men receive a greatly disproportionate share of the nation's transplanted kidneys compared with white women and blacks of both sexes, three recent studies have shown.
